applicability_reasoning: This regulation does not apply to this document for several key reasons: 1) The document is a comprehensive pension scheme rules document, not an advertisement. It contains detailed legal and operational rules for a pension life cover scheme. 2) While the document does contain contact information and website references in Section 6, these are straightforward contact details rather than hyperlinked advertisements. 3) The regulation specifically governs how regulated entities can use hyperlinks within advertisements, while this document is a legal/contractual document establishing scheme rules. 4) The document's purpose is to define the terms, conditions and operations of a pension scheme rather than to advertise or promote financial services. The contact information provided is purely informational rather than promotional in nature.
regulation_title: Hyperlinks linking to information permitted under certain conditions
regulation_text: 76. (1) A regulated entity may include a hyperlink, within an advertisement, linking to information that forms part of the advertisement, where the information given in the advertisement that is not linked in this manner only specifies either or both of the follow ing: (a) the name of the financial service; (b) an invitation to consumers to discuss the financial service in more detail with the regulated entity. (2) The hyperlink referred to in paragraph (1) shall - (a) be displayed prominently within the advertisement, (b) link to all of the information that the regulated entity is required by these Regulations to provide as part of the advertisement, and (c) link directly to the information on a single webpage of the regulated entity's website.
source_name: CENTRAL BANK (SUPERVISION AND ENFORCEMENT) ACT 2013 (SECTION 48) (CONSUMER PROTECTION) REGULATIONS 2025
